Real Madrid: Marcelo tells his fright before the 2018 Champions League final!
The 63rd edition of the league of champions took place in Kiev on May 26, 2018 when Real Madrid raised the big-ear cup by dominating Liverpool on a score of three goals to one. But the emblematic defender of the Merengue, Marcelo returned to this evening where he thought he was going to "die".
01 Nov 2019, 10:40 by Nils Constant



The left-back of Real Madrid, walked the lawn of Santiago-BernabÃ©u in 2007. Since then he has not stopped collecting trophies. The Brazilian returns to the last edition of the league of champions where he thought he would stay there because of an anxiety attack.




Panic fear of the left lateral




Real Madrid + 21 ğŸ“·Credit Photo - Icon Sport

According to the interview of the player's tribune, the Brazilian would have had a big panic attack before starting this final:
"I could not breathe, it happened in the locker room just before the final against Liverpool in 2018. I panicked myself, I had a huge weight on my chest, normally you're nervous before a match but there it was not that, it was different.
For me the pressure was really strong against Liverpool. When I entered the lawn the weight was still there and I thought, you're going to die tonight, there, today and then looking at the balloon I told myself how many children would dream of being in my place, it calmed me down and all the weight flew away. "
After that, the Brazilian played at 100% of his capacity and was able to win a fourth league of champions and allowed Real Madrid to put his 13th showcase.
